result.execSummary:
The defendant Benjamin Charlie Barbeau was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Controlled Substance, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(b).
  • Possession of Controlled Substance, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: St Croix County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Defendant to report to Probation today February 24, 2015 by 11:15 a.m.
Defendant is eligible for expungement upon successful completion of probation under 973.015 but must petition the Court.


In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

miscConds.notes: $243.00 to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in Count 1 Case #14CF31.

-Cooperate with any correctional program as directed by Agent.
-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
-Not to enter any business or establishment where the primary purpose is sale of alcohol.
-Not to operate a motor vehicle without a valid drivers license.
-Random UA's and PBT's.
-Follow all rules and regulations of Agent.
-Pay Supervision fees.
AODA and follow any recommended treatment.

Probation review hearing on April 15, 2015 at 04:15 pm.

CO: Vlack, DAR: Frank, Clerk: Minot,ADA:  Alexis S. Mckinley   DF ATTY:  Stephen J. Dunlap   DF:  Benjamin Charlie Barbeau appeared. Case called at 10:15 am. Court reviews file. Sentencing arguments. B. Lent makes statement. Defendant makes statement. Crt orders:
2 years Probation W/H
- Court Costs; payable through probation
- 25 hours of Community Service
- AODA and recommended treatment
- Cooperate with any correctional program as directed by Agent
- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
- Not to enter any business or establishment where the primary purpose is sale of alcohol.
- Not to operate a motor vehicle without a valid license
- Random UA's and PBTS
- Sign up for Probation on 2/24/2015 by 11:15 am
- Follow all rules and regulations of Agent
- Pay supervision fees
Eligible for expungement when probation is completed  Probation review hearing scheduled for April 15, 2015 at 04:15 pm.
Sentencing hearing on February 24, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Sentencing hearing on February 23, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

  It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, New Richmond Highschool.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Defendant to complete his HSED

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.

CO: Vlack, DAR, Frank, Clerk: Minot, ADA: Amber Hahn   DF ATTY:  Stephen J Dunlap   DF:  Benjamin Charlie Barbeau appeared. Case called at 10:13 am. There is an agreement. Court amends Count 1 to 2 Counts of 961.41(3g)(b) to Poss of controlled substance. Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights.  Defendant understands and pleads Guilty to Count 1 and Count 2 to amended charges. Court questions Defendant.  Court finds that Defendant has freely and voluntarily entered plea and waived rights.  Attorneys stipulate to facts.  Court accepts plea and finds sufficient facts.  Court finds Defendant Guilty of Amended Count 1 and 2. Bond Amended. km  Sentencing hearing scheduled for February 23, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Status conference on May 23, 2014 at 10:00 am.

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, New Richmond High School.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, through the mail, and/or through a third person.
